p:
Each simulated data set is specified by 6 parameters: mean growth rate, μ
A ; standard deviation of the growth rate, σ
A ; mean death rate, μ
B ; standard deviation of the death rate, σ
B ; the number of units in the panel, U; and the number of observations per unit, O. From this we consider 4 possible scenarios: birth-only without parametric variability (μ
B = σ
B = σ
A = 0), birth-only with parametric variability (μ
B = σ
B = 0), birth-death without parametric variability (σ
A = σ
B = 0), and birth-death with parametric variability. In all cases with parametric variability, we assume a Gamma distribution for the respective parameter (where μ and σ are the corresponding mean and standard deviation). We chose the Gamma distribution because it can easily be re-parameterized into its mean and standard deviation, which makes interpreting the parameters straightforward.
